intro: Diplothorax, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. They produce small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. The genus is characterized by its unique leaf structure and the presence of a prominent, hollow stem.
